Name: Luis
description:
Luis is an Indigenous farmer from Jambal√≥, Cauca, with more than three decades of harvesting experience. He owns a one-hectare plot of land granted by the Indigenous council, where he plants 4,000 coffee plants alongside a variety of fruit trees. Luis fertilizes his crops every two months with organic waste, ensuring a fruitful harvest of half a ton monthly.

Luis lives with his wife and two children in a house they built near their land. His wife is also a farmer and works alongside him in crop selection.

A loan of $1,225,383 COP allows Luis to acquire organic fungicides rich in magnesium. These fungicides will help protect his crops from diseases and pests, ensuring their optimal growth and productivity.
